some thoughts:

  • I like the framing of whether it should be a buddy list or a conversation list. If it's a buddy list, then agreed we should exclude Group PMs.

  • I think buddy list is more valuable for open source projects. I think conversation list is more useful for users in a company.

  • I think there's always going to be a decent fraction of users with a PM-first workflow. Even on czo, 1/3 of messages sent are PMs, and we don't have legal/hr/people-coming-from-skype/clients/etc.

I think it's a buddy list. I think conversation lists are generally more valuable ALWAYS, but, like you say, particularly in companies. I'm also on-board with creating a PM-first workflow. I think simplifying thing is actually the long term path. (Right now we have three different widgets for PMs, none of them completely usable. Whereas a more PM-centric attitude would lead us to just one powerful PM widget, and we'd have more screen real estate flexibility.)
(important edit--I think the 'GROUP PMs' thing is a buddy list. So I agree with your logic to exclude it from the strange narrow mode with the crammed sidebar)

Well, I'm imagining a conversation list as the simple solution to creating a PM-friendly workflow. And then the question is where it goes. The options I see are

  • Clicking on Private messages can just toggle the left sidebar, and not change the message feed.
  • We can have an "always on" conversation view (equivalent to an always-open Private messages), which is what I'm proposing.
  • It can go on the right sidebar

(I guess an implicit assumption in bullet 1 above is that part of what makes the current Private messages so bad is that it throws you into a interleaved view, marks a message as read,etc)

• Clicking on Private messages can just toggle the left sidebar, and not change the message feed.

This would be my preference. (And for users who want one-click access to change the feed, we'd provide an always-visible icon right next to it that takes you there.)
I'm also happy to put all things PM-related in the right sidebar and make it easy to toggle between conversation lists, buddy lists, and single-user views.

I'm going to tweak how much space Group PMs takes in the right sidebar:

  • Never ever let it go more than 25%.
  • Never give it more room than it needs.
  • If you have zero group PMs, set its height to zero (or just hide it). This would include the header.

The current algorithm is more complicated, and it's kind of buggy for not really taking into account the headers. And it favors the top list a little too much, since it uses ratios to calculate the sizes, and the top list mostly has useless content, plus it's searchable.
